terms.definition: A systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards through testing, inspection, and documentation.
A software system that provides tools for creating, organizing, storing, and managing technical documents and knowledge bases in a centralized location.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and manage updates systematically.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through web browsers rather than installed locally.
A single, unified storage location where all documents, files, and data are stored and can be accessed by authorized users from multiple locations.
A systematic process of identifying, documenting, and managing instances where products or processes fail to meet specified standards or requirements.
Corrective and Preventive Actions - a systematic approach to identifying root causes of problems and implementing solutions to prevent recurrence.
Detailed, written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently and safely within an organization.
Official records and documents that demonstrate an organization's adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and legal obligations.
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously, with changes visible to all participants instantly.
The process of organizing, reviewing, and compiling all necessary documentation and evidence required for regulatory or compliance inspections.
A systematic method of identifying the underlying reasons for problems or defects to prevent them from recurring in the future.
Groups of employees from different departments or areas of expertise who work together toward a common goal or project.
A structured approach to managing updates and modifications to documents, processes, or systems while maintaining version control and stakeholder communication.
A centralized collection of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems for users or customers.
